bugs.creator: John Matthews
bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause: 
Some packages (mongodb,therubyracer) which requires libv8.so.3 could install v8 from different collection or install system library because it provides required shared object.
 
Fix: 
Shared objects provided by v8 are suffixed with collection name:

libv8.so.v8314 
libv8.so.v8314-3
libv8.so.v8314-3.14.5

Result: 

Dependent collections use suffixed shared objects from v8314 scl
bugs.summary: add "prefix" into shared objects to do not conflict with various v8

bugs.creator: Mrugesh Karnik
bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause: When binary extensions are installed under %gem_extdir/lib/ in a software collection that installs under a namespace other than ruby193, it cannot be loaded. 

Consequence: Collection which depends on ruby193 would not be able to properly use rubygem- packages, which ships binary extensions.

Fix: RubyGems from ruby193 collection can now properly discover locations of binary extensions for dependent collections.

Result: rubygem- package from depending collections, which ships with binary extensions, can be properly loaded now.
bugs.summary: Binary extensions cannot be loaded from %gem_extdir from an scl namespace other than ruby193

Consequence: Previously, it was not possible to acces MongoDB from Ruby without external libraries.

Fix: MongoDB adapter was added to ruby193 SCL.

Result: It is possible to access MongoDB databases from Ruby without installation of external libraries.

bugs.creator: Honza Horak
bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause: 
  Enabling software collections repository in the package
  manager.
Consequence: 
  Installing a Red Hat Enterprise Linux package could
  install some of the software collections packages instead
  of the true package from the Red Hat Enterprise package
  repository. As a result, the code provided by the Red Hat
  Enterprise Linux package might not work.
Fix: 
  All dependency symbols specific to the Perl software
  collections exported on the RPM level were mangled in
  order not to conflict with Red Hat Enterprise Linux
  packages.
Result:
  Enabling software collection repository is safe and does
  not have influence on resolving dependencies among
  Red Hat Enterprise Linux packages.
bugs.summary: Potential issues caused by non-namespaced RPM provides and libraries

In Red Hat Software Collections 1.1, the v8 packages have been replaced by the v8314 Software Collection, which is installed as a dependency. In order to use therubyracer, it is necessary to enable the v8314 Software Collection as well.

bugs.creator: Adam Miller
bugs.cf_release_notes:
Feature: Add  %{gem_extdir_mri} macro for better compatibility with ruby200 collection.

Reason: ruby200 SCL introduces %{gem_extdir_mri} macro for installing rubygem- binary extensions. Adding this macro for ruby193 SCL ensures better compatibility between these two Ruby collections as well as Fedora, which is already using this macro for some time.

Result (if any): Better compatibility with ruby200 SCL and Fedora.
bugs.summary: RHSCL 1.1 - RHEL7 Alpha 1.1 /etc/rpm/macros.rubygems is missing %{gem_extdir_mri}

bugs.creator: Remi Collet
bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause: The environment variable PHP_INI_SCAN_DIR could only be set to a single directory name.

Consequence: A software collection dependent on the php54 collection cannot use an additional directory for configuration files.

Fix: PHP has been patched to allow multiple directory names in the PHP_INI_SCAN_DIR environment variable, as a colon separated list.

Result: A dependent collection can now set PHP_INI_SCAN_DIR appropriately, allowing use of multiple configuration directories.
bugs.summary: Allow multiple paths in php_ini_scan_path

bugs.creator: Stanislav Ochotnicky
bugs.cf_release_notes:
The Java driver from the MongoDB collection and most of the Thermostat collection cannot be rebuilt on Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6. The following steps are necessary before rebuilding the mongodb or thermostat components on Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 from the provided source RPM (SRPM) packages:

1. Install the java-1.7.0-openjdk package from Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6.3 or later and all of its dependencies. 

2. Download, build, and install the maven package and all its dependencies from the SRPM packages for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 Beta or later. For architecture-independent packages it is possible to use the binary packages provided for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.

3. Download and build the main collection SRPM (mongodb24 or thermostat1).

4. Download and build additional SRPM packages including their dependencies.
bugs.summary: mongo, thermostat: Known issues about rebuilding should be documented

bugs.creator: Petr Pisar
bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause:
  Reviewing perl516-perl-Test-Requires-0.07-1.el7 package.
Consequence:
  Missing build-time dependency declarations on File::Spec,
  File::Basename, strict, utf8, warnings modules were
  found.
Fix:
  BuildRequires statements for File::Spec,
  File::Basename, strict, utf8 modules and perl package
  have been added into the specification file.
Result:
  perl516-perl-Test-Requires declares or build-time
  dependencies now.
bugs.summary: Build-time dependency on File::Spec an other modules is missing

bugs.creator: Petr Pisar
bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause: 
  Reviewing perl516-perl-Test-Taint-1.06-6.el6.
Consequence: 
  Build-time dependencies on constant module as well as
  others are missing.
Fix: 
  Build-time dependencies to constant, strict, DynaLoader,
  vars, Tie::StdArray, Tie::StdHash, Tie::StdScalar,
  warnings modules have been added into the specification
  file. Versions at Test::Pod* dependencies have been
  corrected. Useless code deleting so() provides has been
  removed.
Result:
  perl516-perl-Test-Taint source package declares all
  needed build-time dependencies.
bugs.summary: Missing build-time dependency declaration on constant and other modules and other discrepancies

bugs.creator: Petr Pisar
bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause:
  Reviewing perl516-perl-Test-Warn-0.24-8.el6.
Consequence:
  Various package dependencies are wrong.
Fix:
  Build-time dependencieson perl package, constant, strict,
  Test, and warnings Perl modules have been added. Run-time
  dependency on Test::Builder::Tester has been removed.
  Run-time dependency on Test::Builder >= 0.13 has been
  added. Filters to remove under-specified dependencies
  have been utilized.
Result:
  All build- and run-time dependencies for
  perl516-perl-Test-Warn package are declared correctly.
bugs.summary: Wrong dependencies

bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause: 
  Building Perl collection perl-DBD-Pg package.
Consequence: 
  The build process could fail with an error "Unknown tag:
  %tests_req perl516-perl(Cwd)".
Fix: 
  A file delivering tests_req specification macro was moved
  to rh-perl520-build package.
Result:
  After installing scl-utils, scl-utils-build, rh-perl520,
  and rh-perl520-build package, when building 
  a Perl RPM package from a Red Hat Software Collections
  there are no errors about unknown tags.

  Calling any SHA::Digest method on the class.

  The code crashes.

  An upstream released containing the fix was packaged.

  Calling any SHA::Digest method on class yields a proper
  exception instead of perl crash.

bugs.summary: The mysql55-mysqld service fails if the socketfile exists and doesn't check if it's in use.

bugs.creator: Honza Horak
bugs.cf_release_notes: In Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7, the mariadb55-mariadb and mysql55-mysqld services run under the "mysql" user account by default. When the /var/lib/mysql/mysql.sock UNIX socket file is created by a different user, the services have insufficient permissions to check whether a process is listening on the socket but the services have sufficient permissions to delete the socket file. Consequently, the mariadb55-mariadb and mysql55-mysqld services can delete the socket file while a process is still using it.
bugs.summary: MySQL and MariaDB can remove a socket file of a running process when using different user
libmysqlclient.so not available in any mariadb55 package

bugs.creator: Ondřej Pták
bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause:
  Executing "killall httpd" command to terminate an HTTP
  daemon provided by httpd24-httpd package when mod_perl
  Apache module is in use.
Consequence:
  The command cannot find the daemon process.
Fix:
  The daemon was changed to set zeroth argument to its
  short name "httpd", so it is listed under this name
  in a process listing.
Result:
  Its possible to terminate httpd process running
  a Red Hat Software Collection's mod_perl by the
 "killall httpd" command.
bugs.summary: wrong value of /proc/PID/comm

bugs.creator: Jitka Plesnikova
bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause:
  Reviewing rh-perl520-perl-List-AllUtils package.

Consequence:
  License tag for rh-perl520-perl-List-AllUtils binary
  package states "GPL+ or Artistic", but it should be 
  "Artistic 2.0" due to LICENSE file and 
  lib/List/AllUtils.pm.

Fix:
  License tag for rh-perl520-perl-List-AllUtils binary 
  package was changed to "Artistic 2.0".

Result:
  rh-perl520-perl-List-AllUtils package declare correct 
  license.
bugs.summary: perl-List-AllUtils: Wrong license tag

bugs.creator: Petr Pisar
bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause:
  Reviewing rh-perl520-perl-Encode package.
Consequence:
  License tag for rh-perl520-perl-Encode binary package
  states "GPL+ or Artistic" while the package includes
  Unicode tables licensed under UCD terms.
Fix:
  License tags for rh-perl520-perl-Encode and
  rh-perl520-perl-Encode-devel binary packages were changed
  to "(GPL+ or Artistic) and UCD".
Result:
  rh-perl520-perl-Encode packages declare licenses in
  concord with their content.
bugs.summary: rh-perl520-perl-Encode license should be ((GPL+ or Artistic) and UCD)

bugs.creator: Petr Šabata
bugs.summary: Incorrect license tag for perl-Test-Simple

bugs.creator: Petr Pisar
bugs.summary: Wrong license tag for mod_perl package

bugs.creator: Petr Pisar
bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause:
  Reviewing rh-perl520-perl-Text-Template package.
Consequence:
  License tag for rh-perl520-perl-Text-Template
  binary package states "GPL+ or Artistic" while the
  package includes many files licensed under "GPLv2+ or
  Artistic" terms.
Fix:
  License tags for rh-perl520-perl-Text-Template
  packages were changed to "(GPL+ or Artistic) and
  (GPLv2+ or Artistic)".
Result:
  rh-perl520-perl-Text-Template packages declare licenses
  in concord with their content.
bugs.summary: License tag should mention GPLv2+
